intro: Sertula, commonly known as the common sertula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. Sertula is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, shaded conditions. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
